feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 3:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Blustery winds through Saturday... Blustery north to east winds will blow over parts of the Eastern Interior, including the Fairbanks area, through Saturday. Winds gusting 25 to 35 mph through the valley floors and 30 to 40 mph in the hills and mountains are expected through PM Saturday. High profile vehicles traveling on area highways should use caution
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eielson AFB and Salcha; Fairbanks Metro Area; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 02 at 2:37PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT FOR ELEVATED FINE PARTICLE POLLUTION LEVELS DUE TO WILDFIRE SMOKE... The South Coast AQMD has issued an air quality alert due to increased fine particle pollution from wildfire smoke in the region. The air quality alert is in effect from 1:30 PM on Thursday through 5:00 PM on Friday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; Orange County Inland; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Diego County Inland Valleys; Santa Ana Mountains and Foothills

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued November 03 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rainfall Possible East Coast Areas On Saturday... A frontal boundary will move northward into South Florida on Saturday, as a mid level trough moves eastward from the Gulf of Mexico into the Florida Peninsula. This will allow for the steering flow to become southwest over South Florida as the surface winds will remain north northeast due to high pressure
entry.cap:areaDesc: Broward; Miami-Dade; Palm Beach

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 03 at 8:54AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to remain within Minor Flood stage through early next week. This is largely due to wind and higher tides over the adjacent Atlantic, restricting downstream drainage.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 3:37AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING FOR NORTH GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... Relative Humidities of 30 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours this afternoon into the evening. Winds will be E to SE at 5 to 10 MPH. With dry fuels, high fire danger conditions can be expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 3:02AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE RISK EXPECTED TODAY DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... The combination of low relative humidity, and ongoing drought conditions will lead to an elevated fire risk today, especially during the afternoon hours. Relative humidity will drop into the 20`s this afternoon with south winds sustained between 5 and 10 mph. While frequent gusts are not expected, winds could gust
